   20: 
   21: -module(beam_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   24: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2, 
   25: 	 packed_registers/1, apply_last/1, apply_last_bif/1,
   26: 	 buildo_mucho/1, heap_sizes/1, big_lists/1, fconv/1,
   27: 	 select_val/1, swap_temp_apply/1]).
   28: 
   29: -export([applied/2,swap_temp_applied/1]).
   30: 
   31: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   32: -include_lib("syntax_tools/include/merl.hrl").
   33: 
   34: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   35: 
   36: all() -> 
   37:     [packed_registers, apply_last, apply_last_bif,
   38:      buildo_mucho, heap_sizes, big_lists, select_val,
   39:      swap_temp_apply].
   40: 
   41: groups() -> 
   42:     [].
   43: 
   44: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   45:     Config.
   46: 
   47: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   48:     ok.
   49: 
   50: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   51:     Config.
   52: 
   53: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   54:     Config.
   55: 
   56: 
   57: 
   58: %% Verify that apply(M, F, A) is really tail recursive.
   59: apply_last(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   60:     Pid  = spawn(?MODULE, applied, [self(), 10000]),
   61:     Size =
   62: 	receive
   63: 	    {Pid, finished} ->
   64: 		stack_size(Pid)
   65: 	after 30000 ->
   66: 		ct:fail("applied/2 timed out.")
   67: 	end,
   68:     Pid ! die,
   69:     io:format("Size: ~p~n", [Size]),
   70:     if
   71: 	Size < 700 ->
   72: 	    ok;
   73: 	true ->
   74: 	    ct:fail("10000 apply() grew stack too much.")
   75:     end,
   76:     ok.
   77: 
   78: stack_size(Pid) ->
   79:     {heap_size, HS}=process_info(Pid, heap_size),
   80:     {stack_size,SS}=process_info(Pid, stack_size),
   81:     HS+SS.
   82: 
   83: applied(Starter, 0) ->
   84:     Starter ! {self(), finished},
   85:     receive
   86: 	die ->
   87: 	    ok
   88:     end,
   89:     ok;
   90: applied(Starter, N) ->
   91:     apply(?MODULE, applied, [Starter, N-1]).
   92: 
   93: %% Verify that tail-recursive use of apply(M,F,A) on a Bif works."
   94: apply_last_bif(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   95:     apply(erlang, abs, [1]).
   96: 
   97: %% Test whether packing works properly.
   98: packed_registers(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   99:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
  100: 
  101:     %% Generate scrambled sequence.
  102:     Seq0 = [{erlang:phash2(I),I} || I <- lists:seq(0, 260)],
  103:     Seq = [I || {_,I} <- lists:sort(Seq0)],
  104: 
  105:     %% Generate a test modules that uses get_list/3 instructions
  106:     %% with high register numbers.
  107:     S0 = [begin
  108: 	      VarName = list_to_atom("V"++integer_to_list(V)),
  109: 	      {merl:var(VarName),V}
  110: 	  end || V <- Seq],
  111:     Vars = [V || {V,_} <- S0],
  112:     NewVars = [begin
  113: 		   VarName = list_to_atom("M"++integer_to_list(V)),
  114: 		   merl:var(VarName)
  115: 	       end || V <- Seq],
  116:     MoreNewVars = [begin
  117:                        VarName = list_to_atom("MM"++integer_to_list(V)),
  118:                        merl:var(VarName)
  119:                    end || V <- Seq],
  120:     TupleEls = [?Q("id(_@Value@)") || {_,Value} <- S0],
  121:     S = [?Q("_@Var = id(_@Value@)") || {Var,Value} <- S0],
  122:     Code = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n"
  123: 	       "-export([f/0]).\n"
  124: 	       "f() ->\n"
  125:                "Tuple = id({_@TupleEls}),\n"
  126:                "{_@MoreNewVars} = Tuple,\n"
  127: 	       "_@S,\n"
  128: 	       "_ = id(0),\n"
  129: 	       "L = [_@Vars],\n"
  130: 	       "_ = id(1),\n"
  131: 	       "[_@NewVars] = L,\n"		%Test get_list/3.
  132: 	       "_ = id(2),\n"
  133: 	       "id([_@Vars,_@NewVars,_@MoreNewVars]).\n"
  134: 	       "id(I) -> I.\n"]),
  135: 
  136:     merl:compile_and_load(Code, []),
  137: 
  138:     %% Optionally print the generated code.
  139:     PrintCode = false,                          %Change to true to print code.
  140: 
  141:     case PrintCode of
  142:         false ->
  143:             ok;
  144:         true ->
  145:             merl:print(Code),
  146:             erts_debug:df(Mod),
  147:             {ok,Dis} = file:read_file(atom_to_list(Mod)++".dis"),
  148:             io:put_chars(Dis)
  149:     end,
  150: 
  151:     CombinedSeq = Seq ++ Seq ++ Seq,
  152:     CombinedSeq = Mod:f(),
  153: 
  154:     %% Clean up.
  155:     true = code:delete(Mod),
  156:     false = code:purge(Mod),
  157:     ok.
  158: 
  159: buildo_mucho(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  160:     buildo_mucho_1(),
  161:     ok.
  162:

  229: 
  230: heap_sizes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  231:     Sizes = erlang:system_info(heap_sizes),
  232:     io:format("~p heap sizes\n", [length(Sizes)]),
  233:     io:format("~p\n", [Sizes]),
  234: 
  235:     %% Verify that heap sizes increase monotonically.
  236:     Largest = lists:foldl(fun(E, P) when is_integer(P), E > P -> E;
  237: 				   (E, []) -> E
  238: 				end, [], Sizes),
  239: 
  240:     %% Verify that the largest heap size consists of
  241:     %%  - 31 bits of bytes on 32 bits arch
  242:     %%  - at least 52 bits of bytes (48 is the maximum virtual address)
  243:     %%    and at the most 63 bits on 64 bit archs
  244:     %% heap sizes are in words
  245:     case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
  246: 	8 ->
  247: 	    0    = (Largest*8) bsr 63,
  248: 	    true = (Largest*8) > (1 bsl 52);
  249: 	4 ->
  250: 	    1 = (Largest*4) bsr 31
  251:     end,
  252:     ok.
  253: 
  254: %% Thanks to Igor Goryachev.
  255: 
  256: big_lists(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  257:     b(),
  258:     ok.
  259: 
  260: a() ->
  261:     {selected,
  262:      ["uid",
  263:       "nickname",
  264:       "n_family",
  265:       "n_given",
  266:       "email_pref",
  267:       "tel_home_number",
  268:       "tel_cellular_number",
  269:       "adr_home_country",
  270:       "adr_home_locality",
  271:       "adr_home_region",
  272:       "url",
  273:       "gender",
  274:       "bday",
  275:       "constitution",
  276:       "height",
  277:       "weight",
  278:       "hair",
  279:       "routine",
  280:       "smoke",
  281:       "maritalstatus",
  282:       "children",
  283:       "independence",
  284:       "school_number",
  285:       "school_locality",
  286:       "school_title",
  287:       "school_period",
  288:       "org_orgname",
  289:       "title",
  290:       "adr_work_locality",
  291:       "photo_type",
  292:       "photo_binval"],
  293:      [{"test"}]}.
  294: 
  295: b() ->
  296:     case a() of
  297:         {selected,
  298:          ["uid",
  299:           "nickname",
  300:           "n_family",
  301:           "n_given",
  302:           "email_pref",
  303:           "tel_home_number",
  304:           "tel_cellular_number",
  305:           "adr_home_country",
  306:           "adr_home_locality",
  307:           "adr_home_region",
  308:           "url",
  309:           "gender",
  310:           "bday",
  311:           "constitution",
  312:           "height",
  313:           "weight",
  314:           "hair",
  315:           "routine",
  316:           "smoke",
  317:           "maritalstatus",
  318:           "children",
  319:           "independence",
  320:           "school_number",
  321:           "school_locality",
  322:           "school_title",
  323:           "school_period",
  324:           "org_orgname",
  325:           "title",
  326:           "adr_work_locality",
  327:           "photo_type",
  328:           "photo_binval"],
  329:          _} ->
  330: 	    ok
  331:     end.
  332: 
  333: fconv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  334:     do_fconv(atom),
  335:     do_fconv(nil),
  336:     do_fconv(tuple_literal),
  337:     3.0 = do_fconv(1.0, 2.0),
  338:     ok.
  339: 
  340: do_fconv(Type) ->
  341:     try
  342: 	do_fconv(Type, 1.0),
  343: 	ct:fail(no_badarith)
  344:     catch
  345: 	error:badarith ->
  346: 	    ok
  347:     end.
  348: 
  349: do_fconv(atom, Float) when is_float(Float) ->
  350:     Float + a;
  351: do_fconv(nil, Float) when is_float(Float) ->
  352:     Float + [];
  353: do_fconv(tuple_literal, Float) when is_float(Float) ->
  354:     Float + {a,b}.
  355: 
  356: select_val(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  357:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
  358: 
  359:     %% Test select_val instructions around interesting powers of 2.
  360:     Powers = lists:seq(0, 33) ++
  361:         lists:seq(47, 49) ++
  362:         lists:seq(58, 65) ++
  363:         lists:seq(8192 - 5, 8192 + 5),
  364:     L = make_tests(Powers, 0, []),
  365:     Code = make_module(Mod, L),
  366:     merl:compile_and_load(Code, []),
  367: 
  368:     %% Uncomment the following line to print the generated code.
  369:     %%merl:print(Code),
  370: 
  371:     verify(L, Mod),
  372: 
  373:     %% Clean up.
  374:     true = code:delete(Mod),
  375:     false = code:purge(Mod),
  376: 
  377:     ok.
  378: 
  379: verify([{F,L}|T], Mod) ->
  380:     verify_1(L, F, Mod),
  381: 
  382:     Sum = lists:sum([abs(V) || {V,_} <- L]),
  383:     expect_error(Mod, F, -Sum),
  384:     expect_error(Mod, F, Sum),
  385:     expect_error(Mod, F, not_an_integer),
  386: 
  387:     verify(T, Mod);
  388: verify([], _Mod) -> ok.
  389: 
  390: verify_1([{V,Exp}|T], F, Mod) ->
  391:     case Mod:F(V) of
  392:         Exp ->
  393:             verify_1(T, F, Mod);
  394:         Other ->
  395:             io:format("~p:~p(~p) evaluates to ~p; expected ~p",
  396:                       [Mod,F,V,Other,Exp]),
  397:             ct:fail(unexpected_value)
  398:     end;
  399: verify_1([], _, _) -> ok.
  400: 
  401: expect_error(M, F, V) ->
  402:     try M:F(V) of
  403:         UnexpectedSuccess ->
  404:             io:format("~p:~p(~p) evaluates to ~p; expected it to fail",
  405:                       [M,F,V,UnexpectedSuccess]),
  406:             ct:fail(unexpected_success)
  407:     catch error:function_clause:Stk ->
  408:             [{M,F,[V],_}|_] = Stk
  409:     end.
  410: 
  411: make_tests([P|Ps], N0, Acc0) ->
  412:     {Acc,N} = make_tests_1(1 bsl P, N0, Acc0),
  413:     make_tests(Ps, N, Acc);
  414: make_tests([], N0, Acc0) ->
  415:     %% Finally, generate some functions with a huge number of clauses.
  416: 
  417:     {Acc1, N1} = make_huge_bsearch(N0, Acc0),
  418:     {Acc, _N} = make_huge_jump_tab(N1, Acc1),
  419: 
  420:     lists:reverse(Acc).
  421: 
  422: make_tests_1(V, N0, Acc0) ->
  423:     {Acc,N} = make_tests_2(V, N0, Acc0),
  424:     make_tests_2(-V, N, Acc).
  425: 
  426: make_tests_2(V, N0, Acc0) ->
  427:     %% Because the values are not consecutive, a binary search will be
  428:     %% generated.
  429:     NumClauses = 14,
  430:     {Acc1,N1} = make_tests_3(V - NumClauses*5, V, NumClauses, 5, N0, Acc0),
  431: 
  432:     %% Test a binary search with 107 values.
  433:     {Acc,N} = make_test("bsearch", V - 5*50, V + 5*56, 5, N1, Acc1),
  434: 
  435:     %% Use consecutive values to allow a jump table to be used.
  436:     make_test("jump_tab", V - 10, V + 10, 1, N, Acc).
  437: 
  438: make_tests_3(_First, _Last, 0, _Step, N, Acc) ->
  439:     {Acc,N};
  440: make_tests_3(First, Last, NumClauses, Step, N0, Acc0) ->
  441:     {Acc,N} = make_test("f", First, Last, Step, N0, Acc0),
  442:     make_tests_3(First+Step, Last+Step, NumClauses-1, Step, N, Acc).
  443: 
  444: make_huge_jump_tab(N, Acc) ->
  445:     NC = 16384 + 1,
  446:     make_test("huge_jump_tab", 0, NC, 1, N, Acc).
  447: 
  448: make_huge_bsearch(N0, Acc) ->
  449:     NC = 2000,
  450: 
  451:     %% Let the last number be a bignum.
  452:     Last = 1 bsl (erlang:system_info(wordsize)*8 - 5),
  453:     Step = 5,
  454: 
  455:     make_test("huge_bsearch", Last - NC*Step, Last, Step, N0, Acc).
  456: 
  457: make_test(Prefix, First, Last, Step, N, Acc) ->
  458:     Name = list_to_atom(Prefix ++ integer_to_list(N)),
  459:     Seq = lists:seq(First, Last, Step),
  460:     L = [{I,erlang:phash2({I,N})} || I <- Seq],
  461:     {[{Name,L}|Acc],N+1}.
  462: 
  463: make_module(Mod, L) ->
  464:     ModDef = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@')."]),
  465:     Fs = make_funcs(L),
  466:     Xs = [{F,1} || {F,_} <- L],
  467:     Exported = [erl_syntax:arity_qualifier(merl:term(N), merl:term(A)) ||
  468:                    {N,A} <- Xs],
  469:     Export = ?Q("-export(['@_Exported'/1])."),
  470:     [ModDef, Export | Fs].
  471: 
  472: make_funcs([{Name,List}|T]) ->
  473:     [make_func(Name, List) | make_funcs(T)];
  474: make_funcs([]) -> [].
  475: 
  476: make_func(Name, List) ->
  477:     Cs = [?Q(["(_@I@) -> _@Body@"]) || {I,Body} <- List],
  478:     erl_syntax:function(erl_syntax:atom(Name), Cs).
  479: 
  480: swap_temp_apply(_Config) ->
  481:     {swap_temp_applied,42} = do_swap_temp_apply(41),
  482:     not_an_integer = do_swap_temp_apply(not_an_integer),
  483:     ok.
  484: 
  485: do_swap_temp_apply(Msg) ->
  486:     case swap_temp_apply_function(Msg) of
  487: 	undefined -> Msg;
  488: 	Type ->
  489: 	    %% The following sequence:
  490: 	    %%   move {x,0} {x,2}
  491: 	    %%   move {y,0} {x,0}
  492: 	    %%   move {x,2} {y,0}
  493: 	    %%   apply 1
  494: 	    %%
  495: 	    %% Would be incorrectly transformed to:
  496: 	    %%   swap {x,0} {y,0}
  497: 	    %%   apply 1
  498: 	    %%
  499: 	    %% ({x,1} is the module, {x,2} the function to be applied).
  500: 	    %%
  501: 	    %% If the instructions are to be transformed, the correct
  502: 	    %% transformation is:
  503: 	    %%
  504: 	    %%   swap_temp {x,0} {y,0} {x,2}
  505: 	    %%   apply 1
  506: 	    Fields = ?MODULE:Type(Msg),
  507: 	    {Type,Fields}
  508:     end.
  509: 
  510: swap_temp_apply_function(Int) when is_integer(Int) ->
  511:     swap_temp_applied;
  512: swap_temp_apply_function(_) ->
  513:     undefined.
  514: 
  515: swap_temp_applied(Int) ->
  516:     Int+1.
